Dad-Built Fitness For The Long Millennium

We train kitchens, garages, sidewalks, and cul-de-sacs for sustained human strength in domestic gravity fields. Every plan is authored by Coach Hal Mercer, certified suburban father, Year 3000 municipal movement specialist, and keeper of the weekly orange cone drills.

Now accepting Spring Orbit Cohorts | District Time Zone: UTC-05 Residential

Homefront Conditioning Bulletin

Edition 44.3 | Printed Midnight

Flagship Program: Lawnline Protocol

Forty nights. Porchlight pacework. Bagged sand carries. Slow lunging between mailbox sectors. This is neighborhood-grade conditioning with strict form language and daily breath checks at the fence line.

What You Get

  • Personal cadence map for your block radius
  • Meal timing around school-drop orbital traffic
  • Garage warmup sequence in under eight minutes
  • Weekly call-in from Coach Hal's folding table command station

FAQ

Do I need equipment?
No. A curb, a wall, two grocery bags, and one safe floor are enough.
Is this for beginners?
Yes. The first week is called Quiet Engine and starts below ego speed.
Can couples enroll together?
Yes. Pair lanes are available when both participants complete household clearance forms.
